The cluster can't phone home, so to speak.
You, for example, can't get upgrades

The customer would then have to operate their own internal

You want to usually have the latest and greatest

running a system that has known vulnerabilities in it.

And there are two big things that you need for that.
There's the platform upgrades that is just

it's basically like the App Store for OpenShift,

So mirroring is basically just taking something that exists in this public
registry and putting it one to one into your internal disconnected registry.
Then it will take the release images and operate images from our official Red Hat registries

The cluster will expect things to be at the official Red Hat registry location.
